itemLabel: Edwina Mountbatten, Countess Mountbatten of Burma

wikipedia_page.main: Edwina Cynthia Annette Mountbatten, Countess Mountbatten of Burma,  (née Ashley; 28 November 1901 – 21 February 1960), was an English heiress, socialite, relief worker and the last vicereine of India as the wife of Admiral of the Fleet The 1st Earl Mountbatten of Burma.

response: ** Edwina Mountbatten, Countess Mountbatten of Burma (b. 1901), last Vicereine of India
|1929|| Armstrong Whitworth|| flew an Argosy from Croydon to Paris, Douglas Fairbanks and Mary Pickford met Edwina Mountbatten, Countess Mountbatten of Burma in 1929.

In 1960, she visited India at the invitation of Rajkumari Amrit Kaur, who had been impressed by Princess Andrew's interest in Indian religious thought, and for her own spiritual quest. The trip was cut short when she unexpectedly took ill, and her sister-in-law, Edwina Mountbatten, Countess Mountbatten of Burma, who happened to be passing through Delhi on her own tour, had to smooth things with the Indian hosts who were taken aback at Princess Andrew's sudden change of plans. She later claimed she had had an out-of-body experience.Vickers, pp. 364–366 Edwina continued her own tour, and died the following month.
* Edwina Mountbatten, Countess Mountbatten of Burma (1924; former Lady Louis Mountbatten)
* Edwina Mountbatten, Countess Mountbatten of Burma (1901–1960), was buried at sea from HMS Wakeful off the coast of Portsmouth.
#REDIRECT Edwina Mountbatten, Countess Mountbatten of Burma

Lady Pamela Carmen Louise Hicks (née Mountbatten; born 19 April 1929) is a British aristocrat and relative of the British royal family. She is the younger daughter of Louis Mountbatten, 1st Earl Mountbatten of Burma (formerly Prince Louis of Battenberg) and  Edwina Mountbatten, Countess Mountbatten of Burma. Through her father, Lady Pamela is a first cousin of the late Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, and a grandniece of the last Empress of Russia, Alexandra Feodorovna. She served as a bridesmaid and later as a lady-in-waiting to Queen Elizabeth II.
